snippet: An infusion of $550,000 in public money will help Common Cents, the charity that operates the drive known as the penny harvest and educates students on charitable giving, to avoid shutting down this year.
abstract: New York City Council Speaker Christine C Quinn announces allocation of $550,000 in public money for Common Cents charity; nonprofit group oversees penny harvest, popular fundraising drive in city's schools aimed at educating students about charitable giving; charity has been struggling, badly hurt by recession-driven decline in philanthropic giving from foundations that underwrite it.
lead_paragraph: An infusion of $550,000 in public money will help Common Cents, the charity that operates the drive known as the penny harvest and educates students on charitable giving, to avoid shutting down this year.

headline.main: Penny Harvest Charitable Group to Stay Afloat With City Money
headline.print_headline: City Funds Will Keep Afloat Children’s Charitable Group
